snippet: Staff Sgt. Robert Bales is accused of killing 16 Afghan civilians, but his lawyers said questions remained.
abstract: Military prosecutors will seek the death penalty in case against Staff Sgt Robert Bales, who is accused of murdering 16 Afghan civilians in May rampage; defendant's lawyers raise questions about his mental and physical state at the time of crime, including fact that he was under the influence of several substances.
lead_paragraph: Staff Sgt. Robert Bales is accused of killing 16 Afghan civilians, but his lawyers said questions remained.

headline.seo: Army Seeks Death Penalty for Robert Bales in Massacre
headline.main: Army Seeks Death Penalty in Afghan Massacre
headline.print_headline: Army Seeks Death Penalty In Afghan Massacre Case
